summary: This is an FBI Digital Evidence Laboratory report detailing the forensic examination of a Digital Video Recorder (DVR) system related to the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation. The report documents the receipt, attempted assembly, and analysis of multiple DVR components and hard drives from August 2019 to May 2021, noting partial success in recovering video from one DVR unit and catastrophic failures in another.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject (UNSUB) in a death investigation. The DVR system being examined is part of this investigation.

persons.name: Kim
persons.context: FBI Video Specialist who performed exports of available video recordings from the DVR system based on investigative team requests.

persons.name: M M
persons.context: Computer Analysis Response Team (CART) Laboratory Supervisor consulted regarding the assembly of the DVR system for video export.

persons.name: M i la
persons.context: Technical Support Representative from SigNet Technologies (the DVR vendor) who provided an overview of the system's operation during a meeting on September 18, 2019.

persons.name: Loveall
persons.context: Senior Advisor who, along with a Computer Scientist, reviewed DVR 2 controller logs which indicated catastrophic disk failures.

events.title: Evidence Submission for Examination
events.description: Digital Video Recorder (DVR) system and related hard drives were submitted to the FBI's Digital Evidence Laboratory in Quantico, VA for forensic examination in the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation.

events.title: CART Consultation on DVR Assembly
events.description: CART Laboratory Supervisor M M was consulted regarding the plan to assemble the DVR system to allow export of videos.

events.title: Meeting with DVR Vendor
events.description: A meeting was held with DVR vendor Technical Support Representative M i la of SigNet Technologies to discuss the operation of the system.

events.title: DVR 1 Hardware Failure
events.description: DVR 1 failed due to hardware issues (memory errors), preventing further video exports. Attempts to repair it with replacement parts were unsuccessful.

events.title: DVR 2 Catastrophic Disk Failure
events.description: Logs on the DVR 2 controller indicated catastrophic disk failures occurred on or before this date, meaning no recordings would have been available after it.

events.title: Report of Examination Issued
events.description: The FBI Digital Evidence Laboratory issued this final report summarizing the examination conducted from August 20, 2019, to May 24, 2021.

keyFacts: The FBI examined a DVR system as part of the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation, attempting to recover surveillance video.
DVR 1 was partially successful; videos were exported by Video Specialist Kim before the unit failed due to hardware issues in December 2019.
DVR 2 had experienced catastrophic disk failures prior to FBI receipt (logs indicated failures by July 29, 2019) and could never be assembled successfully.
The examination period spanned from August 20, 2019, to May 24, 2021, indicating a lengthy and technically complex forensic process.
Master copies of the recovered data (images and video exports) were placed on three hard drives (HQQ026637-HQQ026639) for storage and provided to the New York field office.
